title: Social Justice Ministry working with Education Ministry on transgender-inclusive education in schools: Union Social Justice Secretary
content: The remarks come days after the Supreme Court issued notices to the Centre, several States, and the NCERT, on a petition seeking integration of transgender-inclusive comprehensive sexuality education into school curricula across the country

title: A.P. Cabinet approves health policy for all families in State with ₹25 lakh coverage
content: 3,257 medical procedures to be offered free of cost, scheme to be applicable irrespective of economic status; Cabinet also clears setting up of 10 medical colleges under PPP model

title: Parappa block panchayat in Kasaragod gets approval for brain health initiative
content: Under the programme, follow-up treatment and therapies will be provided for Parkinson’s disease, epilepsy, dementia, and other brain-related disorders

title: Kottayam to host conclave on ‘emerging career trends’ in November
content: Global conclave will bring together academic scientists, researchers, and practitioners to deliberate on multidisciplinary fields influencing career development

title: Gujarat to reduce penalties for illegal construction, public space encroachment, tax default
content: State Assembly to pass new Bill to decriminalise minor offences to reduce judicial burden and improve ease of doing business

title: Rahul Gandhi asks Tribal Affairs Minister to examine alleged FRA violations in Nicobar project
content: Tribal council representing Nicobarese people says A&N administration falsely claimed FRA processes were completed before forest clearance was granted for the ₹72,000 crore mega infrastructure project

title: Amid U.S. tariff lows, Guwahati Tea Auction Centre posts high growth
content: The auction centre, the world’s largest for CTC or granular tea, also set a benchmark for 100% dust sales

title: Unions raise concerns about teachers’ job security
content: State, Union governments urged to intervene in the wake of a Supreme Court ruling making clearing of Teachers’ Eligibility Test mandatory for all schoolteachers

title: 8-Year-Old With Kidney Disorder Stranded In Flooded Punjab. How You Can Help
content: Punjab's most devastating floods since 1988, which have left at least 37 dead, have also made life even more difficult for an eight-year-old suffering from a kidney ailment, whose village has been badly hit.

title: "Biggest Reform Of Independent India": PM Modi Applauds GST Rationalisation
content: The rationalisation of Goods and Services Tax is the "biggest reform since Independence," Prime Minister Narendra Modi said today

title: Obama's LinkedIn Shows Trump's Photo. Here's Why
content: Former US President Barack Obama's LinkedIn profile has taken an unusual twist. It now displays a photo of current US President Donald Trump.

title: "Congress Even Taxed Children's Toffees": PM Modi Attacks Opposition On GST
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, speaking on the rationalization of Goods and Services Tax today, attacked the Opposition Congress, pointing out that they taxed anything and everything -- daily essentials, food and medicine

title: India, EU Reaffirm Commitment To Seal Proposed Free Trade Deal
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and top European Union leaders Antonio Costa and Ursula von der Leyen on Thursday reaffirmed their commitment to seal the proposed India-EU free trade deal as soon as possible.

title: Video: 'Total Cringe, Chill Sesh'- Putin Tries Gen Z Slang At Economic Forum
content: A video from the event shows a young woman explaining how language shifts between formal and slang. Putin repeated the slang line with a smile, drawing laughs from onlookers.

title: "No Regret": UP Man Shoots Wife To Death Over Divorce Row, Say Cops
content: A woman was allegedly shot dead by her husband in a crowded market in this Uttar Pradesh district, following a dispute over their ongoing divorce proceedings, police said on Thursday.

title: Why No Action Against Russia? Trump Snaps At Reporter With "India" Reply
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he put secondary sanctions on India for buying Russian oil and indicated that he hasn't done "phase two yet or phase three."

title: Tamil Nadu Government Allocates Funds For Chennai Metro's Phase 1 Extension
content: In a big relief to Chennai suburb, Tamil Nadu government has released an order allocating funds of Rs 1,964 crores for Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) phase 1 extension between Chennai Airport and New Kalaingar Bus Terminus at Kilambakkam.

title: Why Nepal Is Blocking Social Media Platforms Like Facebook, X And YouTube
content: Nepal's government said Thursday it is blocking most social media platforms including Facebook, X and YouTube because the companies failed to comply with regulations that required them to register with the government.

title: Portugal Holds Day Of Mourning As Lisbon Streetcar Accident Death Count Rises To 16
content: Portugal held a day of national mourning on Thursday as the death count from the derailment of one of Lisbon's iconic funiculars rose to 16 people, with 21 injured.

title: Stop "Collective Punishment" In Gaza, Pope Leo XIV Tells Israeli President
content: Pope Leo XIV met Thursday with Israeli President Isaac Herzog, as Israel presses ahead with a planned offensive in Gaza and the Vatican is urging an immediate ceasefire and return of hostages taken by Hamas.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Nuclear Bomb That Israel Fears Might Not Come From Iran At All
content: While a worst-case scenario in which Iran decides to build a bomb seems unlikely, plans for nuclear arms control in the region seem to have been shelved for the time being.

title: "Tariff Call Centres": US Influencers Target India Over Visas, Immigration
content: American right-wing commentators have launched a campaign against India, using trade tensions and immigration as rallying points in an increasingly hostile debate on social media.

title: GST Reform: Inside Story of How Opposition-Ruled States Were Convinced
content: The rationalisation of Goods and Services tax, done eight years after the flagship reforms were initiated, took place after a clear directive from Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivered from the ramparts of the Red Fort on Independence Day.

title: Trump Links India Tariffs To Ending Ukraine War In Supreme Court Plea
content: US President Donald Trump's administration has moved the Supreme Court to challenge a federal appeals court ruling that decreed most of his sweeping tariffs illegal.

title: Afghanistan Earthquake Deadliest In Decades, Deaths Cross 2,200
content: The death count in the devastating earthquake in eastern Afghanistan has crossed 2,200, news agency AFP reported, quoting a government spokesman.

title: Tariffs, Immigration, Other Trump Moves To Dominate US Supreme Court Docket
content: President Donald Trump has pushed the boundaries of executive power to impose sweeping tariffs, crack down on immigration and attempt to fire a Federal Reserve governor, and these actions could dominate the US Supreme Court's upcoming docket.

title: Kukis Open Key Manipur Highway, Arms-Down Agreement With Insurgents Extended
content: A key organisation representing a section of the Kuki and Zomi tribes in Manipur has decided to open the state's lifeline, National Highway-02, for free movement of commuters and cargo two years after ethnic clashes broke out in the state.

title: Zelensky Meets European Leaders In Paris To Finalise Ukraine Security Guarantees
content: European leaders and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky were meeting in Paris on Thursday to agree on security guarantees for Kyiv in the event of a peace accord with Russia to end the three-and-a-half-year war sparked by Moscow's 2022 invasion.

title: Naidu for CBI probe into Sugali Preethi case
content: CM to form Cabinet sub-committee to draft regulations to curb spread of fake and misleading posts on social media

title: Watch: Why are TN restaurants logging off Swiggy and Zomato? | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: In this video, we look at how app-based food delivery is facing a shake-up in Tamil Nadu, with restaurants ditching Swiggy and Zomato for a lesser-known homegrown alternative. What’s behind this sudden migration?

title: HUDCO issues letter sanctioning ₹9,303.66 crore loan to B-SMILE for Tunnel Road project
content: HUDCO asks government to transfer Premium FAR and Advertisement revenue of entire Bengaluru into an escrow account to repay loan, condition to hit revenue of new corporations

title: Tribal youth, who empowered 2000 tribal and Dalit youths with higher education, looks for support
content: TISS alumnus has been working for the last eight years to democratise higher education for the backward communities of India, has reached five lakh underprivileged youth till now

title: GST has become simpler; new rates to be effective from first day of Navratri: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister said that during the Congress regime, basic household items used to be “heavily taxed” and the BJP government has tried to address those issues for the ease of the common man

title: U.S. tariff hikes  put Kerala in a spot of bother
content: As the tariff war announced by U.S. President Donald Trump has upset economies worldwide, India is also feeling the pinch. Tiki Rajwi speaks to industry captains, economists, and political leadership of the State to understand what the new tariff regime really means to Kerala, a major exporter of marine products, spices, garments, electronic components and electric machinery and equipment

title: Phase II of Pattom canal renovation works gets administrative sanction
content: Works include removal of silt and mud to increase the canal’s depth and construction of protective walls. Phase I of the project had protected low-lying areas near the canal from flooding in the recent rains

title: IIM-K retains top spot in NIRF for third consecutive year
content: The institution has sustained its forward momentum with an overall score rising from 74.74 in 2022 to 76.48 in 2023, 77.90 in 2024, and now 79.85 in 2025

title: Stephen Devassy set to strike a chord of unity with Ekta
content: A musical production undertaken by Devassy in collaboration with over 200  artistes from across the world will be released in February or March next year after a four-year long wait

title: TUDA starts e-auction of plots at Padmavathi Nagar Layout
content: TUDA Secretary says that 277 plots are vacant out of 985 plots developed in an extent of 145 acres of land near Surappakasam on the highway between Tiruchanur to Renigunta

title: BJP demands immediate compensation for farmers hit by torrential rain in Yadgir
content: The district received torrential rainfall for a couple of weeks last month causing extensive damage to crops and also, houses

title: CM visits flood-hit Kamareddy, wants depts to work in close coordination for relief work
content: Internal coordination is very important in effectively mitigating the plight of the affected. Collectors should see that departments work together: Revanth Reddy

title: Pawan Khera’s wife gets notice for duplicate voter registration
content: The Electoral Registration Officer of the New Delhi assembly constituency issued a notice to Pawan Khera’s wife and shared a copy of it on X.

title: Plea seeks FIR against Sonia Gandhi for getting her name into electoral rolls three years prior to getting citizenship
content: Petitioner alleges that the Congress leader might have used forged documents to get her name included in the electoral rolls

title: UAS Dharwad to host mega farm fair from Sept. 13
content: The annual Krishi Mela showcases new farm technologies, innovations in the farm sector, new varieties and other farm-related developments

title: Dharmasthala case: Seers meet Amit Shah, seek NIA probe
content: BJP and JD(S) leaders too demand an NIA probe into the alleged mass burials case, and to expose the conspiracy against the Manjunatheswara temple

title: PM Modi discusses India-EU Summit with European leaders
content: The leaders discussed organising the next India-EU Summit in India at an early date of mutual convenience.

title: Streets teem with last-minute shoppers on Thiruvonam eve in Kerala
content: With Uthrada Pachil in full swing, grocery, flower, and vegetable shops do brisk business all over the State. The high demand has predictably pushed up prices, but the escalation has been lower than past years

title: Focus on advancements in intelligent communication networks, their applications
content: Guru Nanak Dev Engineering College Bidar hosts IEEE International Conference on Intelligent Communication Networks and Computational Techniques

title: Global Ayyappa Sangamam looks to gain ground as Opposition struggles to unite
content: The summit has received backing from the Nair Service Society and the Sree Narayana Dharmaparipalana Yogam. State government is riding the momentum generated by the support from influential community organisations

title: Universities should be active in protecting environment, says Governor
content: Gehlot tells youth to participate in making India self-reliant and developed by 2047 through talent, entrepreneurship, innovation

title: The buzz ahead of NFL Week 1: Expectations for the Cowboys, playoff sleepers, fantasy predictions
content: Our reporters have intel on the Micah Parsons trade, teams and players flying under the radar and coaching situations to watch -- plus Week 1 fantasy nuggets.

title: Bonitto now top-paid non-QB in Broncos history
content: Nik Bonitto and the Broncos reached agreement on a four-year, $106 million extension that includes $70 million guaranteed, Athletes First announced Thursday.

title: USWNT's Macario: Serena's Chelsea ties 'a win'
content: Chelsea's Catarina Macario said she feels Serena Williams' affiliation with her club perfectly encapsulates the upward trajectory of women's football.

title: Source: Jets' Vera-Tucker (triceps) out for season
content: Jets starting right guard Alijah Vera-Tucker will undergo season-ending surgery for a torn triceps, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Reports: Koch family to buy 10% stake in Giants
content: The Koch family has agreed to purchase a 10% stake in the New York Giants, as first reported by Bloomberg on Wednesday.

title: Sky's Reese: Didn't mean to put down teammates
content: Angel Reese said Wednesday night she apologized to her Sky teammates for remarks she made to the Chicago Tribune.

title: Nearly $80M in NIL deals get commission's OK
content: The new College Sports Commission has cleared more than 8,300 NIL deals worth nearly $80 million and says 28,342 students have signed up on its NIL Go platform.

title: Sources: Nets' Thomas picks $6M qualifying offer
content: Restricted free agent Cam Thomas has opted for the qualifying offer with the Nets that gives him a full no-trade clause and sets him for unrestricted free agency next summer with at least 10 teams set to have cap space, sources told ESPN.

title: 🤔 The 11 biggest fantasy questions for Week 1
content: How the Bears' offense will look, TreVeyon Henderson's role and Travis Hunter's snap count are among the curiosities.

title: How much will Tucker get? Who could sign Schwarber? Passan's early MLB free agency intel
content: MLB front offices are already thinking ahead to the offseason. Here are the storylines that will rule the winter.

title: MLB Power Rankings: NL contender reenters top 10 as September begins
content: The AL's top teams are battling for the No. 1 seed while one NL contender is picking up steam at the right time.

title: The ultimate upset: How Amanda Anisimova beat Iga Swiatek
content: Fewer than two months ago, Swiatek bested Anisimova in the Wimbledon final 6-0, 6-0. On Wednesday, Ansimova got her revenge.

title: What will Saquon Barkley do for an Eagles encore?
content: 2,000 yards? Check. Super Bowl ring? Check. What's next? Some of the greatest RBs of all time have an idea.

title: 'Let's get the gleam': Brian Schottenheimer carries legacy of his dad, Marty, in Super Bowl chase
content: The Cowboys coach expects to be emotional ahead of Thursday's game, as he thinks of his father, the longtime NFL coach.

title: Eagles' A.J. Brown wants more for himself, and for others
content: All indications point to Brown being "hungrier than ever," as the Eagles begin to defend their title.

title: Why Michigan has already rallied behind Bryce Underwood
content: With comparisons to Trevor Lawrence ahead of an early test against Oklahoma, the lore around the nation's No. 1 freshman is growing.

title: Solak predicts this season's NFL stat leaders: Every player who could finish No. 1 in five categories
content: Which QBs could top the NFL in passing yards or INTs? Who could dominate rushing and receiving? And what about sack leader candidates on defense?

title: The Playbook: Your fantasy football guide for Week 1 games
content: Mike Clay provides an all-encompassing look at Week 1's matchups to exploit and avoid in weekly fantasy, including projected final scores.

title: What are the odds? Top 25 predicted anytime NFL TD scorers for Week 1
content: Mike Clay's reveals his top 25 predicted touchdown scorers for Week 1, comparing implied odds to ESPN BET's.

title: College football best bets: Why to take the over for Cyclones-Hawkeyes
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 2, including a look at the Iowa State-Iowa game.

title: 'Hell, no. I can't be that fourth': What Carmelo Anthony did -- and didn't do -- to land in Springfield
content: Nineteen seasons, six teams, three gold medals and 28,289 points: Here's why Melo's career will forever be known for far more than just a Hall of Fame résumé.

title: The Life of a (halftime) Showgirl? Roger Goodell says Taylor Swift a 'maybe' for Super Bowl LX
content: The pop superstar, who is engaged to Travis Kelce, could serve as the headliner for the Super Bowl LX halftime show.

title: Pochettino, Pulisic must reconcile for USMNT to be at its best
content: Ahead of next summer's World Cup on home soil, it will be important for USMNT manager Mauricio Pochettino and star player Christian Pulisic to rebuild their relationship.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can the Fighting Nerds keep rolling at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night: Imavov vs. Borralho? Anthony Smith and Din Thomas make their picks and betting insider Ian Parker gives his best bets.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ men's college basketball teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're updating key rosters as players arrive on campus for the 2025-26 season.

title: Ahead of Monza, why Mercedes is keeping faith in Antonelli
content: Kimi Antonelli is the 18-year-old next big thing of Formula 1, and ahead of his return to Monza, he will continue to prove that at Mercedes.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Ronaldo wants Al Nassr to sign Mason Greenwood
content: Cristiano Ronaldo wants Mason Greenwood to join Al Nassr as Saudi Arabian clubs look to strengthen before the deadline. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'India has big role to play': EU leaders speak to PM Modi; Ukraine in focus
content: Prime Minister Modi engaged in discussions with EU leaders, focusing on strengthening bilateral ties and addressing global issues like trade, technology, and the Ukraine conflict. They aim to finalize the India-EU Free Trade Agreement and implement the India–Middle East–Europe Economic Corridor.

title: Will GST 2.0 counter Trump's tariffs? India's GDP may grow faster; here's why
content: The Modi government has announced better-than-expected GST reforms and rate structure rationalisation, with a majority of items consumed by the common man and middle class set to see price cuts from September 22, the start of the Navratras. But will the GST rate cuts be enough to counter the impact of Trump’s 50% tariffs on India?

title: Emotions over expletives: Will NDA's offensive trump Mahagathbandhan's 'chori' charge
content: Bihar's NDA called a bandh to protest insults against PM Modi's mother during a Congress rally, drawing mixed reactions. While the NDA aims to consolidate its women voter base ahead of state elections, the opposition RJD criticized the bandh's conduct and accused the NDA of opportunism.

title: 'Dhoni treated people like shit': Yograj Singh's scathing attack, backs Irfan
content: Yograj Singh, father of Yuvraj, has unleashed harsh criticism on MS Dhoni, Kapil Dev, and Bishan Singh Bedi, accusing them of mistreating players. Irfan Pathan addressed a resurfaced video controversy linked to his ouster from the Indian team under Dhoni’s captaincy. Yograj backed Pathan’s claims, highlighting other players who have spoken against Dhoni's leadership and decisions.

title: Trump speaks on Elon Musk: Calls out plans; reignites political-tech crossover
content: Donald Trump recently commented on Elon Musk, acknowledging his genius while noting some "problems." Trump expressed hope Musk would rejoin the GOP, dismissing the "radical left lunatics." This follows a fallout sparked by Musk's criticism of Trump's tax bill. Despite earlier threats, Trump now wishes Musk well.

title: Giorgio Armani, icon of Italian Fashion, dies at 91
content: Giorgio Armani, the iconic Italian fashion designer renowned for his elegant and sophisticated designs, has passed away at the age of 91. Credited with redefining modern Italian style through minimalist designs and timeless sophistication, Armani's creations graced red carpets and boardrooms alike. He built his independent fashion house into a global powerhouse, leaving an indelible mark on the fashion world.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; Staff must report personal usage
content: Amazon is now requiring employees to meticulously report the percentage of work-related usage on their company-issued phones. This is to adjust their $50 monthly reimbursements proportionally, based on personal use. This phone monitoring is part of CEO Andy Jassy's "hardcore culture reset" and cost-cutting measures, leading to employee frustration and anxiety about job security.

title: Big fight in US court: Trump cites India to justify tariff war
content: Donald Trump has appealed to the Supreme Court, challenging a federal court's decision that limits his power to impose tariffs on foreign imports. Trump defends tariffs on India for purchasing Russian energy, citing it as crucial for peace in Ukraine.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
content: The Goods and Services Tax Council approved new GST reforms. The council reduced the slabs to 5% and 18%. Nirmala Sitharaman announced the changes. The revised rates take effect from September 22. Consumer electronics like ACs and TVs will see a price cut. Mobile phone and laptop GST rates remain unchanged. Air conditioners and dishwashers will also become cheaper.

title: Nepal bans X, Insta & FB: Action after SC order; 'non-compliance' cited as reason
content: Nepal has blocked 26 social media platforms. These platforms did not register with the government. The action follows a Supreme Court order. Major platforms like Meta and X are affected. Some platforms like Viber and TikTok have registered. The government had given a seven-day deadline. Unregistered platforms face a ban. They can resume services after registration and compliance.

title: Sonia Gandhi voter ID row: Plea alleges she was listed 3 years before citizenship
content: A plea has been filed in a Delhi court seeking action against Sonia Gandhi, alleging her name appeared on the electoral rolls in 1980, three years before she officially became an Indian citizen in 1983. The complainant, Vikas Tripathi, through senior advocate Pavan Narang, argues this discrepancy suggests potential forgery and deception of public authorities.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: Toll crosses 2200, nearly 4000 injured; rescue under way
content: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake in eastern Afghanistan has claimed over 2,200 lives and injured nearly 4,000, primarily in Kunar province. Rescue operations are ongoing amidst difficult terrain, complicated by aftershocks, including a 4.8-magnitude tremor. International aid is arriving, with India airlifting 21 tonnes of relief supplies to assist the affected population already struggling with fragile housing and decades of conflict.

title: WB assembly chaos: Mamata launches tirade; BJP MLAs dragged out, suspended
content: The West Bengal Assembly erupted in chaos as TMC and BJP MLAs clashed over a resolution addressing alleged atrocities against Bengali migrants. Chief minister Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP of being anti-Bengali and obstructing discussions on attacks in BJP-ruled states. Addressing the House, Banerjee accused the BJP of being against Bangla-speaking people.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
content: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Confession without a corpse: Kozhikode's 5-year puzzle of a man lost in marshland
content: Five years after Vijil vanished from Kerala, his disappearance remains a perplexing mystery. Two friends confessed to burying him after a drug overdose at Sarovaram Park, but no remains have been found despite extensive searches. Vijil's parents dispute the drug story, suspecting foul play, leaving investigators grappling with a case shrouded in uncertainty and a family without closure.

title: 'I was very troubled by her': Man shoots wife dead in busy market in Gorakhpur
content: In Gorakhpur, Vishwakarma Chauhan fatally shot his wife, Mamta, in a public market on Jail Road. The incident occurred after an argument outside a photo studio where Mamta had gone.

title: Irfan Pathan vs Dhoni: After hookah, old Army gloves controversy storms back online
content: Irfan Pathan is facing renewed scrutiny after an old interview resurfaced where he suggested MS Dhoni favored players who joined him in smoking hookah, sparking controversy.

title: NIRF 2025: AIIMS Delhi tops medical ranking; check top 10
content: The NIRF 2025 medical rankings have been released, with AIIMS Delhi maintaining its top position for the tenth consecutive year. The list highlights India’s leading medical institutes, including PGIMER Chandigarh and Christian Medical College, Vellore. Rankings are based on teaching quality, research, graduation outcomes, inclusivity, and perception. The top 10 includes both public and private institutions, reflecting India’s growing medical education landscape. This ranking serves as a key guide for prospective medical students.

title: Aligarh dowry horror: ‘Jump’, dares hubby, woman leaps off 2nd floor
content: In Aligarh's Daunkoli village, Archana, a 35-year-old woman, allegedly jumped from her roof after enduring years of dowry-related abuse. A video surfaced showing the aftermath, leading to a police case against her husband and in-laws. They are accused of demanding additional dowry of Rs 5 lakh and a motorcycle.

title: 'Failed FM': Chandrasekhar's 'disgruntled' retort on Chidambaram's GST 'U-turn' claim
content: Kerala BJP president Rajeev Chandrasekhar strongly criticized Congress leader P. Chidambaram's remarks on the GST overhaul, labeling him a "dejected, disgruntled, and failed finance minister." This came after Chidambaram called the GST reforms a belated "U-turn," suggesting they should have occurred eight years prior.

title: Punjab floods: Amid disaster, rail parts maker switches to boats
content: Hanspal Traders, a railway coach component manufacturer in Kapurthala, has shifted its operations to fabricate boats for Punjab flood relief. Prompted by calls from across the state and encouraged by an MLA, the company is also sharing its designs to involve other manufacturers. They aim to produce boats manually, focusing on aiding people and transporting essential supplies.

title: Asia Cup: India's Dubai schedule revealed - player arrivals, practice timings & more
content: Defending champions India are set to commence their Asia Cup 2025 preparations with practice sessions in Dubai, foregoing a preparatory camp in India. Players will assemble individually, with captain Suryakumar Yadav and coach Gautam Gambhir already en route. India's campaign begins against UAE on September 10, followed by a highly anticipated match against Pakistan on September 14.

title: NBA set to investigate Kawhi Leonard's Los Angeles Clippers deal
content: NBA has launched an investigation into Kawhi Leonard and the Los Angeles Clippers following reports of a potential salary cap circumvention. Allegedly, Leonard signed a $28 million endorsement deal with Aspiration, a fintech company, around the same time Clippers owner Steve Ballmer invested heavily in the firm.

title: Watch: BJP whip dragged out of Bengal assembly as Mamata shouts 'vote chor'
content: West Bengal Assembly witnessed chaos as Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP of corruption and anti-Bengali sentiment, triggering fierce opposition. BJP chief whip Shankar Ghosh was suspended for disrupting a discussion on Bengali migrants' rights. Marshals escorted Ghosh out after he refused to leave.

title: Minor rape survivor sent back to accused family by CWC, raped again; 10 booked
content: In Panna, Madhya Pradesh, police filed an FIR against ten individuals, including Child Welfare Committee members and officials from the women and child development department, under the POCSO and Juvenile Justice Acts. The action was prompted by the CWC's decision to return a minor rape survivor to the accused's family, leading to further abuse.

title: Magic of Bumrah: In a world of Messi vs Ronaldo, he is the Ibrahimovic - an outlier
content: Jasprit Bumrah thrives on challenges. He is a non-conformist. He has always chosen the unconventional route. While most athletes are swayed by the Messi-Ronaldo rivalry, his inspiration comes from Zlatan Ibrahimovic, a monster in his own right. During Covid-19, in an Instagram Live with Rohit Sharma, Bumrah had said: "I love Ibra. I can relate to his story that people did not take him seriously and then he became a star. I can relate as I think people took me lightly initially and then I proved them wrong, I am still trying."

title: Will Taylor Swift attend Travis Kelce and Chiefs game in Brazil on September 5
content: Travis Kelce will play in Brazil on September 5, 2025. Taylor Swift's presence is a big topic. She might attend the Chiefs vs Chargers game. Security arrangements are rumored. Swift's past experience in Brazil is a factor. She has supported Kelce at many games. Her new album releases on October 3. Her schedule might allow her to travel to Brazil.

title: CCTV footage exposes brutal police attack on Youth Congress member in Kerala
content: CCTV footage revealed the torture of a Youth Congress worker, V S Sujith, at Kunnamkulam police station, sparking protests and a human rights commission investigation. A magistrate ordered an inquiry against four officers after medical tests disproved police claims of Sujith's intoxication. While departmental action was taken against some officers, further action depends on the court's decision.

title: Delhi rains: Alipur flyover portion caves in
content: New Delhi faced disruptions due to heavy rainfall. A portion of the NH-44 flyover collapsed. Waterlogging and traffic jams were widespread. The Yamuna River exceeded the danger level. Chief Minister Rekha Gupta assessed the situation and assured assistance. The IMD forecasts more rain in the coming days. Interstate cooperation is underway to manage the crisis. Air quality remained satisfactory.

title: South Park mocks Trump again; shows Satan pregnant with his child
content: US president Donald Trump faced mockery in the recent South Park episode which aired on Wednesday. The show satirised Trump's relationship with Melania. It also depicted Satan's romantic involvement with Trump. Satan claimed pregnancy and an inability to leave Trump. The episode further included jokes on tariffs and the Labubu craze.

title: Peace in Manipur? Tripartite pact signed, NH-2 reopens; PM likely to visit soon
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs, Manipur government, and Kuki-Zo groups have signed a tripartite Suspension of Operations (SoO) agreement, aiming to restore peace after the ethnic conflict. Key provisions include maintaining Manipur's territorial integrity, reopening National Highway-2, and relocating militant camps. The agreement emphasizes a negotiated solution and strict enforcement of revised ground rules to ensure lasting stability.

title: Internal affairs: Why Delhi’s residential roads face a dead end
content: Internal roads in Delhi are in disrepair due to a lack of funds and ineffective schemes. The MCD faces a severe financial crunch, hindering road maintenance despite its responsibility for 12,700km of roads. Residents in areas like Green Park Extension and Laxmi Nagar express frustration over persistent potholes and delayed repairs, with temporary fixes proving inadequate.

title: ‘BJP begging before US, China’: Mamata’s jibe at Centre; alleges India’s prestige sold
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP-led Union government of compromising India's prestige by allegedly "begging" before foreign powers like the US and China. During a state assembly discussion on attacks against Bengali migrants, Banerjee alleged the BJP has a dictatorial mindset and aims to turn West Bengal into its colony.

title: Watch: Pope Leo rides BMW motorcycle in St Peter’s Square
content: Pope Leo XIV received a custom BMW motorcycle from the Christian Jesus Bikers, who rode from Germany to Rome as part of a Jubilee of Hope pilgrimage. The Pope blessed and signed the bike, which will be auctioned in Munich to benefit children working in mica mines in Madagascar. The Jesus Bikers have a history of presenting motorcycles to popes.

title: World Athletics: Arshad Nadeem fully fit; set for showdown with Neeraj Chopra
content: Arshad Nadeem, Pakistan's Olympic javelin champion, is declared fully fit after calf surgery, setting up a highly anticipated showdown with India's world champion Neeraj Chopra at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo. Despite disrupted training due to heavy rains, Nadeem's coach confirms he is training vigorously. The rivalry between Chopra and Nadeem promises to be a major highlight.

title: CBSE portal for special needs students: Registration starts Sept 9; apply online
content: Central Board of Secondary Education sets the registration dates for Children With Special Needs. This is for the upcoming Class 10 and 12 board exams in 2026. Schools need to register eligible students on the Pariksha Sangam portal. The registration window is from September 9 to September 22, 2025. Registered students will receive accommodations during exams.

title: 40% tax rate in GST rejig: What are sin goods and why they are in highest slab?
content: The GST Council has approved a significant tax hike on sin and luxury goods, introducing a new 40% slab for items like tobacco, aerated drinks, and premium vehicles. This restructuring aims to simplify the indirect tax system by reducing the number of tax slabs.

title: 'I fear encounter': On the run, AAP MLA posts video from unknown location
content: Punjab Police are actively searching for AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, who is accused of sexual exploitation and other charges. Pathanmajra released a video denying allegations of attacking police during an attempted arrest in Haryana.

title: NIRF 2025: IISc B'luru tops; JNU at number 2; see India’s top 10 universities
content: The NIRF 2025 rankings showcase India's leading universities. IISc Bengaluru secures the top spot, followed by JNU New Delhi. MAHE and Jamia Millia Islamia also perform well. These rankings guide students in choosing quality institutions. Private universities are rising, emphasizing research and global collaborations. The rankings consider inclusivity and community engagement. Students can find competitive programs in diverse institutions.

title: GST rate cuts & rationalisation: Top winners & losers of new tax slabs - check list
content: The GST Council has approved a restructured indirect tax system, effective September 22nd, featuring simplified rates of 5% and 18%, with a 40% category for luxury and sin goods. This reform eliminates the 12% and 28% slabs, aiming to streamline tax administration.

title: Shocking claims! 'I was depressed': Amit Mishra on career gap after retirement
content: Amit Mishra, the veteran leg-spinner, has retired from professional cricket after 25 years. He debuted in 2003 but faced a five-year gap due to strong competition. Mishra made a notable Test debut in 2008, claiming five wickets. Despite facing depression, he persevered, focusing on self-improvement. He ended his career with 156 international wickets.

title: Josh Allen cried at end of Hailee Steinfeld's 'Sinners' performance
